definition: to move along with the body prone and close to the ground
examples: A spider was creeping along the bathroom floor.

definition: to move slowly on hands and knees
examples: He crept toward the edge of the cliff.

definition: to go timidly or cautiously so as to escape notice
examples: She crept away from the festive scene.

definition: to enter or advance gradually so as to be almost unnoticed
examples: A note of irritation crept into her voice.

definition: to have the sensation of being covered with creeping things
examples: The thought made his flesh creep.

definition: to spread or grow over a surface rooting at intervals or clinging with tendrils, stems, or aerial roots
to slip or gradually shift position
examples: The high temperatures of the jet engine cause the turbine blade to creep.

definition: to change shape permanently from prolonged stress or exposure to high temperatures
a movement of or like creeping
a distressing sensation like that caused by the creeping of insects over one's flesh, a feeling of apprehension or horror
a feed trough accessible only by young animals and used especially to supply special or supplementary feed
the slow change of dimensions of an object from prolonged exposure to high temperature or stress
a slow but persistent increase or elevation
examples: This political inertia … makes budget creep inevitable.
